sections.title: Strategic Innovation Vision
sections.description: Evaluate the clarity and integration of innovation in your organization's strategy

questions.text: To what extent is innovation integrated into your organization's strategic vision?

options.text: Innovation is not explicitly mentioned in our strategic vision
Innovation is mentioned generally but without specific objectives
Innovation is part of our vision with some defined objectives
Innovation is fully integrated with clear and measurable objectives
Innovation is at the heart of our strategy with a detailed roadmap

questions.text: How does your executive management communicate about the importance of innovation?

options.text: Rarely or never any communication about innovation
Constant and exemplary communication, management leads by example

questions.text: To what extent does innovation influence major strategic decisions?

options.text: Innovation is not considered in strategic decisions
Innovation is sometimes a decision factor
Innovation is often an important criterion
Innovation is systematically integrated into all strategic decisions

questions.text: How do you measure the return on investment (ROI) of innovation?

options.text: Structured measurement system with defined indicators

questions.text: What is the budget allocation dedicated to innovation in your organization?

options.text: No specific budget allocated to innovation
Significant and growing budget (> 10% of revenue)

sections.title: Governance and Organization
sections.description: Analyze the organizational structure and decision-making processes related to innovation

questions.text: How is innovation organized within your structure?

options.text: Innovation integrated across all departments with central coordination

questions.text: What is the level of management involvement in innovation projects?

options.text: Direct leadership and sponsoring of initiatives

questions.text: How are innovation decisions made in your organization?

options.text: No defined process for innovation decisions
Optimized process with clear criteria and agile governance

questions.text: To what extent is innovation integrated into individual objectives?

options.text: Innovation doesn't appear in any individual objectives
Innovation is in the objectives of certain departments
All employees have innovation objectives adapted to their role

questions.text: How do you manage risks related to innovation projects?

options.text: Basic risk assessment project by project
Portfolio approach with calculated risk acceptance

sections.title: Human Resources and Skills
sections.description: Evaluate skills, training, and team engagement in innovation

questions.text: How do you develop your employees' innovation skills?

options.text: Innovation training program for certain profiles
Internal academy with personalized paths and certification

questions.text: To what extent do you encourage initiative-taking and experimentation?

options.text: Experimentation culture with assumed right to fail

questions.text: How do you recognize and reward innovation efforts?

options.text: Complete system: rewards, career advancement, profit sharing

questions.text: What is the level of employee engagement in innovation initiatives?

options.text: Very low engagement, resistance to change
Engagement limited to a few volunteers
Good level of engagement in most teams
Strong and widespread engagement, innovation driven by all

questions.text: How do you integrate creative and innovative profiles into your teams?

options.text: No specific strategy to attract innovative profiles
Strong employer brand on innovation, natural attraction of talent

sections.title: Innovation Culture
sections.description: Measure your organization's mindset and values towards innovation

questions.text: How would you describe the general attitude towards change in your organization?

options.text: Neutral attitude, change according to needs
Strong appetite for change and continuous improvement

questions.text: To what extent is failure tolerated and used as learning?

options.text: Failure is sanctioned, culture of perfection
Failure is seen as a learning opportunity
Fast fail culture, celebration of constructive failures

questions.text: How do you foster cross-functional collaboration and idea exchange?

options.text: Dedicated spaces and time for cross-functional exchanges
Strong collaborative culture with dedicated tools and rituals

questions.text: What level of autonomy is granted to teams to innovate?
How do you integrate diversity of thought into your innovation processes?

options.text: Active strategy to integrate different profiles
Diversity as a pillar of innovation strategy

sections.title: Processes and Methods
sections.description: Analyze the structure and efficiency of your innovation processes

questions.text: How do you structure your innovation process, from idea to market launch?

options.text: Basic process with some defined stages
Structured process with gates and clear criteria
Optimized, agile and adaptive process according to contexts

questions.text: What innovation methods do you use regularly?

options.text: Some creative methods (design thinking, lean startup...)
Palette of methods adapted to contexts
Advanced mastery of multiple methodologies with continuous training

questions.text: How do you manage your innovation project portfolio?

options.text: Portfolio management with resource allocation and arbitration
Continuous portfolio optimization with advanced metrics

questions.text: To what extent do you integrate prototyping and testing into your projects?

options.text: Occasional prototyping at end of project
Systematic approach to prototyping and testing
Generalized rapid and iterative prototyping culture

questions.text: How do you measure and manage the performance of your innovations?

sections.title: Technology and Tools
sections.description: Evaluate the use of technology to support innovation

questions.text: How do you use digital tools to support innovation?

options.text: Some specialized tools for certain projects
Advanced technological ecosystem with AI and analytics

questions.text: To what extent do you leverage data to guide your innovations?

options.text: No use of data for innovation
Data analytics integrated into innovation process
Artificial intelligence and big data serving innovation

questions.text: How does your organization position itself regarding emerging technologies?

options.text: Pioneer in adoption and technological experimentation

questions.text: What is your maturity level in terms of digital transformation?
How do you protect and valorize your intellectual property?

options.text: IP protection process for key projects
IP strategy integrated into innovation process
Advanced IP management as strategic asset

sections.title: Partnerships and Ecosystem
sections.description: Measure your ability to create and manage an open innovation ecosystem

questions.text: To what extent do you collaborate with external partners to innovate?
How do you integrate your customers into your innovation process?

options.text: Customer feedback collected at end of project
Customer partners integrated into innovation process

questions.text: What is your level of collaboration with startups and entrepreneurs?
How do you collaborate with academia and research?
To what extent do you participate in innovation communities and events?

sections.title: Market and Customer Orientation
sections.description: Analyze your customer-centric approach and market knowledge

questions.text: How do you analyze customer needs to guide your innovations?

options.text: No specific analysis of customer needs
Continuous needs analysis with dedicated tools
Real-time customer intelligence integrated into innovation

questions.text: To what extent do you test your innovations with end users?
How do you anticipate market evolution and emerging trends?
What is your approach to adapt your innovations to different market segments?
How do you measure the impact of your innovations on customer satisfaction?

options.text: Continuous measurement of customer experience and innovation NPS
